comments.body: In "Minecraft Dungeons Cinematic Tralier" is explained why zombies do not attack pillagers. This ARCH-ILLAGER found ORB OF DOMINACE that caused monsters not to attack his people (Illagers & Pillagers)
personally i like the way it works, the battle is more challenging and beacons worth it, if you have troubles at this fight just put game in easy-mode i guess?
I agree the wither fight is way to hard on bedrock.
In my opinion, the bedrock wither is better than the java one because it's more challenging and makes beacons worth more than they are now.

The Bedrock wither is more difficult, in the most naive and boring form of difficulty. It has double health, regenerates faster, and has extremely erratic movement and attacks.

This results in a fight that is not a test of skill or strategy, but merely a boring endurance test and equipment check. Do you have really good armor and weapons and basic competence? Then you can grind out the unengaging fight over the course of five minutes.

Sure, the Java wither has its problems (like the bedrock ceiling cheese), but it at least fills its role better. It can be managed by approaching the fight creatively, and doesn't grind you out with an unnecessarily long HP bar. You have a chance to use your surroundings to your advantage, and dodge its attacks.

More "difficult" does not mean better boss design.

I personally think that the Bedrock wither is closer to what it should be than the Java wither. Java withers are too easy and Bedrock withers are too hard for the wrong reason. I love how the Bedrock wither is more unpredictable, it has more dangerous attacks like a body charge and more large blue head projectiles, I don't even mind the regen but double the health can feel a bit ridiculous. I suggest that all withers on Java and Bedrock have the Bedrock wither attacking mechanics/attacks, but 1.5 times the health of Java withers currently. So, all withers would have health that is in between current Java and Bedrock wither health.
It has twice the health super unfair and the either can beat the warden in bedrock

Sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo it’s a lava drowned

To call them "lava drowned" is an oversimplification. 

Unlike Drowned (which can only spawn in water in the Overworld), Damned are able to spawn anywhere in the Nether - not just in lava.

Really, the only similarity between Damned and Drowned (besides that they are both variations of Zombies) is the concept of the bident.  Though the bident may be similar to the trident, it has its own unique properties - as proposed and outlined above.

Again, I think that this proposed Damned mob would make the Nether much more scary, interesting, and dangerous.
No bident it is just a trident clone. give it a unique thing maybe a gauntlet inspired weapon

I get it Minecraft keeps saying oh we might add this golem that golem but they never do it make’s me so mad that the iron golem’s brother is a golem that’s made out of snow and is very dumb acting

Mojang is close to making something that works, the Tuff and Copper golems both had mechanics that caused either a "cool down" or "maintenance" effect which is the right track for useful golems. The problem was the Tuff and Copper weren't that useful for most players.

Golems need functionality that helps the players, Iron is melee defense, and the Snow golem a fun range mob to lure in hostiles. what is missing is some ranged attacker, and automation uses for players.

A ranged golem could have a limited inventory for arrows, potions, etc. 3 slots but basically gives an automated dispenser towards hostiles. 

Automations are really there to reduce grind, Farming (for those who don't want to use villagers), Lumber harvesting (could be a simple block breaker golem and then redstone automation to place the wood in front of it), Fishing, animal breeding, crafting (really doubt they allow that). there's a variety of tasks that could be done by golems to ease up the grind for players balanced by either the speed being slower than a player and/or the player has to maintain the golem periodically. Let alone the cost of making these golems could be more than an Iron or Snow rationally. 

Or even a guard (modified Glare) that patrols along edges of lighted areas and "alarms" at nearby hostiles, can even be led by the player via lesh or following light.

If Mojang puts forth a golem with real functionality to players it will win a mob vote.

True. However, these ideas can be posted in comment form on the giraffe page. Mojang has said they will read any and all comments on posts. I would reserve making any new posts for when an existing idea is low-voted and/or when the ideas are so far from your own. I do think this is a good idea! :)
I like that idea

I second this idea. There's a lot that can be done with Hippos if they're added:

-They could be a neutral mob since real hippos are highly aggressive if provoked.

-They could spend the day in the water and come out onto land at night to feed/graze (real hippos do this iirc).

-They could have an intimidation animation where they open their mouths and, if that fails, charge at whatever provoked them.

-They'd be surprisingly fast and hard to take down, since hippos in the real world are among the most dangerous animals in Africa.

-They could have a unique animation with melons since there are videos that I've seen of hippos crushing Melons in their jaws and eating them.

-Some Hippos could naturally fight each other if there's a shortage of water in the area.

-Hippos could mainly spawn in Savanna, Jungle, and/or Swamp Biomes given those biomes are where real hippos generally live.

I just think it would be awesome to see Hippos in Minecraft so I support this idea.
If MOJANG STUDIOS Added Hippos they should have them in mangroves and savannah and jungle edge
